thread.title: Fiver worth £50,000 handed back to art gallery in Kelso
thread.title_full: Fiver worth £50,000 handed back to art gallery in Kelso | Border - ITV News

author: itv.com
title: Fiver worth £50,000 handed back to art gallery in Kelso
text:
Credit: PA A mystery woman who found a rare five pound note worth £50,000 has donated it to charity.
The woman, known only as 'J' found the note in Northern Ireland.
It's one of four that have an engraved picture of Jane Austen on.
She's now given it back to the art gallery in Kelso behind the engraving project:
I haven't met somebody with that much generosity in my entire life.
It's not a few pounds that she's giving to someone who's homeless this is tens of thousands of pounds that she's giving to charity, even though she could have just kept it for herself.
– Michael Huggins, Tony Huggins-Haig Gallery Last updated Fri 24 Feb 2017 Scottish Borders
